Portal 2 es tan hipnótico y adictivo para el que juega como para el que simplemente observa, y esta es una facultad que es prácticamente imposible de conseguir en estos tiempos sin una propuesta jugable tan impresionante como la suya. Es un juego indispensable para todo jugador … pero claro primero tienes que jugar al 1 para que la experiencia sea mejor ya que es una continuación de una historia muy buena y llena de humor con nuevos personajes
Tiene nuevas mecánicas con los geles que se agregan a esta entrega el gel azul de revote el gel naranja de aceleración y el gel blanco para pintar una superficie y poder hacer ahí un portal
También tiene un multijugador muy bueno y una gran comunidad
8/10

Şuana kadar böyle bir oyuna denk gelmemiştim. Arkadaşım tavsiye ettiğinde, yav kardeşim altı üstü bir bulmaca oyunu neyini bu kadar beğeniyorlar falan diye sözler söylemiştim. Benim ağzım çıksaydı da demeseydim bu nasıl bir oyundur kardeşim, size samimi söylüyorum oyun sırasında o kadar çok duygu yaşadım ki bunu size sözlerle tarif etmem imkansız. Özellikle oyundaki espiriler, iyice katlanarak zorlanan bulmacalar ve tabi ki size yaşattığı o tarif edilemez duygular diğer oyunlarınızı bir kenara bırakın ve şu güzelim oyunu oynayın. Bu arada oyuna bulmaca çözeceğim kafasıyla girmeyin oyunun enfes bir hikayesi var ayrıca türkçe dil desteği de olduğu için konuşmaları sürekli takip edin ki eğlenebilesiniz yoksa bulmaca çözdüğünüzle kalırsınız.

So, I recently completed Portal, and that was one amazing ride. This game takes what we learned about Portal and Apeture Science and rips it apart, letting us see the true innerworkings of the lab. We're introduced into more characters, and the story is stronger than ever before, and there's not a single point where you don't have a goal in mind.

So a short review, here's this. Portal 2 takes everything you experienced in Portal and adds so much more on top of it, including new mechanics, newly themed areas, a new, bigger story, and even a new main character. This game is an amazing treat for any Portal fan, and I'd highly recommend it.

Now, for the full review. And quick note, there [b]is spoilers[/b]. This game is constantly revealing more as you go, and it's very, very hard to talk about this game without bringing up those plot points.

Now, I'll begin with the simple story that is the beginning. You wake up in a containment room, where you've been held since the ending of the first game. You do some basic exercises, then you're put back to sleep, where you're not woken up for a large amount of time. A small robot appears at your door, who we eventually learn is named Wheatly. He is trying to help you get out of the crumbling facility. From there, you and Wheatly make your way through, and eventually reach GLaDOS, which Wheatly accidentally activates. She throws Wheatly to the side, and says it's time to begin testing again.

So you're thrown into a brand new set of tests. The enhanced visuals and the beatiful art style of the worn out facility is great, and I can't help but really enjoy it. You get through most of the puzzles before Wheatly finally pulls you away so you can escape, and you're on to an escape portion, which interesting puzzles. 

I'm not explaining exactly what happens, but let's just say that Wheatly turns GLaDOS into a potatoe, and Wheatly goes power crazy and smashes the escape pod you and GLaDOS are in, and fall to the very bottom, where the original labs were.

As you fall down, GLaDOS gets taken away by a hungry bird, but we'll catch up to her later on. You go through and explore the area, and you learn that this was the original Apeture Labs where Cave Johnson took in test subjects to test the new major mechanic of this game: Gel. This section of the game is crazy fun. You meet up with GLaDOS and mess with blue gel, which makes you jump higher, orange gel, which makes you run insanely fast, and white gel, which allows you to place portals on it.

All the while, GLaDOS is making connection to Cave Johnson's assistant (who is heard on the speakers), Carol. She then decides that you and her should work together, and if you can get GLaDOS back in control, she'll let you leave the lab. You and GLaDOS then escape the old laboratory, and confront Wheatly, who puts you through a series of new chambers (that were created by GLaDOS a long time ago). Even these chambers have new mechanics, which is great. At this point in the game, you're about half way through, and they're still giving you new things to play with. And note, these puzzles are far more difficult than the ones from before. From that point, you go onto defeat Wheatly (who has no idea how to maintain the facility) in the opposite way you defeated GLaDOS. I'm not spoiling the very end, but I'll leave you with that.

So, I guess it's time to give my complete thoughts on this game. For starters, I love the difficulty curve. Whereas in the last game, some of the later chambers were easier than some of the early chambers, this game gradually gets more difficult. On the other hand, there were points where I was stumped for a good 15-20 minutes, just experimenting. That's a good and a bad thing. I still enjoy the fact that you can get through the game just by experimenting, but it does eventually take a long time to get through a single chamber, and while it's fun, it's also boring at the same time. In Portal, I never was bored. Never a dull moment.

That's not the case with this game.

I frequently found myself progressing just for the sake of progessing. This problem really only happened in the gel sections, but it still taught me new mechanics, so... I can't complain new mechanics. I guess I'm just in different about this game. Everything was super fun and exciting, and I loved the story, yet, at the same time, it got boring more often than I'd like it to. But, the good moments very much so outweigh the bad ones.

The updated visuals are beautiful. This game looks crisp and clean, and I absolutely love it. I especially love it when GLaDOS cleans up the facility, and for a little bit, it's the updated visuals but with the style of the original game. It's honestly really pleasing to look at.

Now, if the long campaign is not enough, there's also the rather lengthy multiplayer campaign, where you can grab a friend locally, or play online. This mode is where most of my time in this game prior to this review came from. This mode is so much fun with a friend, and the puzzles are hard, but rewarding.

And if that's still not enough, there's Community Chambers, where you can create your own chambers, and play through Community made ones. This is fun, and with the thousands of Community Chambers there are, you could easily get lost in this one if you want a new, difficult challenge. Believe me, these ones are not easy.

Now, if the hundreds of hours the base game can provide is still not enough, there's mods as well, which add a lot to the game, and there's some that I personally will be playing soon.

The base story itself is great, and there's so much this game has to offer, it's hard to get tired of this game. So, in conclusion, I did enjoy this game. Maybe not as much as the first one, but there is so much more here to do, that it makes up for it. I do plan on playing this more. This game is perfect for anyone that is a fan of the first game.

I'd give this game a [b]9/10[/b].

После первой части, я был уверен - в этой серии нечего больше придумывать. Основные механики уже знакомы, наверняка сделают только новый набор камер, - но как же я ошибался.

С самого начала вам показывают масштабность происходящего. Не просто большие камеры и коридоры между ними, а гигантские сферы из асбеста, завод по переработке турелей, движущиеся камеры испытаний, которые трансформируются и сталкиваются на ходу. Все это подается с внутренней историей и отсылками вселенной Half-Life. Если поискать, то можно понять что в центре производились исследования не только связанные с портальным перемещением, здесь находился корабль который должен был появиться в третьем эпизоде Half-Life. Уровни отлично сбалансированы и разнообразны. Часто приходится высматривать место для порталов в полукилометровых зонах, взаимодействовать с различными механизмами. Задачи не сложные, стоит только подумать немного -  все проходится без подглядывания в различные учебники.

Юмор и персонажи это, чуть ли, не главное за что стоит любить игру. Стало понятно - сколько не выдумывай уровней, играть становиться скучно. Главных героев всего три это вы (немая сумасшедшая), Гладос и Уитли. За битвой искусственных интеллектов вам и предстоит наблюдать. Причем, не просто комментариями в начале и конце уровня, но и во время игрового процесса. За героев переживаешь и умиляешься, ненавидишь и смеешься над ними и с ними. Не смотря на то, что сюжет прямолинеен, и вы по большей части просто делаете то, что вам говорят.

К механикам добавили: световые мосты, гравитационные лифты и три вида геля. Эффектно совмещая по мере прохождения мы получаем так понравившуюся модель с физическими головоломками, на совершенно новом уровне. Гель, действительно добавляет индивидуальности и творческого процесса игровому процессу. Уровни можно создавать и загружать из мастерской, там их великое множество от простых, но выглядящих эффектно, до хардкорных, где важны тайминги и реакция.

Кооперативное прохождение кардинально меняет методы прохождения, взаимодействия и построения уровней. Имея напарника, вы можете строить уже четыре портала и это снова переворачивает ваше восприятие уровня. Играя с другом вы буквально строите теории прохождения, чувствуя интеллектуальную битву. Существует несколько глав сюжетного кооперативного прохождения, а так же множество уровней из мастерской.

Веселая, интересная и несколько раз переворачивающая ваше восприятие игра, где можно исследовать, строить, командно взаимодействовать с другом и кончено же - думать, а не убивать. Незначительное, серьезное повреждение мозга получено.

[10/10]

Portal è un classico oltre che un faro da sempre acceso sulla scena videoludica.
Portal 2 è un capolavoro – che diventerà un classico e un faro per sempre acceso.
Grafica estremamente piacevole e curata nei dettagli, (esorto, ad esempio, a prestare attenzione ai vari segnali che si incontrano procedendo nel gioco). Lo storytelling, (a differenza di Portal, che non ne ha uno vero e proprio), qui si definisce assieme a una serie di espedienti geniali e percorrendo "scenari parlanti" che, pur essendo solo visuali, dicono tutto ciò che c'è da dire, e lo fanno a volte in modo criptico e altre "sub sole").
Uno dei titolo più belli di sempre. Assolutamente consigliato.
